channel.title: Help Needed Read UnAnswered!
channel.description:
Ok so i want to change the teleport called ape atol i want to know how to change the name and were it teleports to.
I also want to know how to make a command called ::switch with this you can switch from anceint to normal and from normal to anceints.
how do i change it so when you die you will be revived in a certain place?

item.title: Help Needed Read UnAnswered!
item.dc:creator: @freeky freeky
item.description:
@freeky wrote:

the youdied thing dont work -.-[br][br][size=1]Posted on: May 28, 2009, 01:57:19 am[/size][hr]and so for the switch thing i have to but this code in my client?

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“switch”)) {
usingAncients = !usingAncients;
sendMessage(“You have switched to " + ((usingAncients) ? “ancient” : “normal”) + " magic.”);
}

does this turn from normal to ancients and how do i make it turn to normal from ancients also were do i put the code anywere sensible?

Read full topic

item.title: Help Needed Read UnAnswered!
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

Oh, yeah, if you managed to have lunar magic in your server it would be necessary to use a different data type.

Read full topic

item.title: Help Needed Read UnAnswered!
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“xx qwertyuiop xx, post:11, topic:280685”]Why use an integer for a variable that will only ever have 2 different values?
Use a boolean.

public boolean usingAncients = false;

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("switch")) { usingAncients = !usingAncients; sendMessage("You have switched to " + ((usingAncients) ? "ancient" : "normal") + " magic."); } [/quote]
Oh yeah, I forgot about that. But there are probably three; I was only giving two as an example. (Normal, ancients, and lunar.)

Read full topic

item.title: Help Needed Read UnAnswered!
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

Why use an integer for a variable that will only ever have 2 different values?
Use a boolean.

public boolean usingAncients = false;
if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("switch")) {
    usingAncients = !usingAncients;
    sendMessage("You have switched to " + ((usingAncients) ? "ancient" : "normal") + " magic.");
}

Read full topic

item.title: Help Needed Read UnAnswered!
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“x blitz x, post:8, topic:280685”][quote author=jc22493 link=topic=370726.msg2801701#msg2801701 date=1243472837]

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("switch") { if(variable = 1) { variable = 2; else if(variable = 2) { variable = 1; } } }
[/quote]
WHAT HAPPENED TO THE CONVENTIONS???

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("switch") { if(variable = 1) { variable = 2; } else { variable = 1; } }[/quote]
SHATTAP.

I don’t like including the brackets before and after the ‘else’, noob. Take 'em out now.

Read full topic

item.title: Help Needed Read UnAnswered!
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

[quote=“x blitz x, post:8, topic:280685”][quote author=jc22493 link=topic=370726.msg2801701#msg2801701 date=1243472837]

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("switch") { if(variable = 1) { variable = 2; else if(variable = 2) { variable = 1; } } }
[/quote]
WHAT HAPPENED TO THE CONVENTIONS???

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("switch") { if(variable = 1) { variable = 2; } else { variable = 1; } }[/quote]

He typed it in a post, plus it’s just an example for the kid to learn off, if he planned on using it, then yes, conventions would be used.

^ So many commas.

Read full topic

item.title: Help Needed Read UnAnswered!
item.dc:creator: @pk3r_john pk3r john
item.description:
@pk3r_john wrote:

For ::switch, it will be in your client class. Just make a command and the switch code will be something like this:

spellbook = 2;

Sorry, I just got that off the top of my head, although I know it includes something related to that.

Read full topic

item.title: Help Needed Read UnAnswered!
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

For the death respawn area, you can edit it through the youdied() method in the client class.

Read full topic
